evidence: Clear separation of concerns with dedicated packages for models, resources, and authentication
Models and resources are organized by domain entities (documents, files, groups, profiles)
Consistent package structure with __init__.py files indicating intentional modularization
Low average fan-out (1.74) suggests loose coupling between modules
Resource layer abstracts API interactions from model implementations
Models inherit from common base classes, showing inheritance-based organization
Test structure mirrors source code organization with clear module boundaries
risks: Deep directory nesting (max depth 4) could indicate over-modularization
Some modules may have implicit dependencies not captured in metrics
Authentication logic is mixed with core domain models
